comments:
Several users from the newsgroup have indicated that they can never use the 
Java scrapbook as it always fails to retrieve an evaluation context.

I cannot reproduce the problem but am working with an individual to work out 
what is going wrong.

Very strange indeed

I have 2 projects:
both i have a scrapbook page called test.jpage

in both i have the same line:
System.out.println("asdf")

in the first project the executing is always going OK
But in the second i get that error (evalution context)
or this stacktrace: 
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: CodeSnippet_10
	at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:198)

Mostly those errors switch: If i execute the "good" project then go to the bad 
then most of the time now the above stacktrace is thrown if do the same code 
right after that again then i get the context error. (internal error)

I have to look what is really the difference between those 2 projects but for 
now i can only say one thing: The good project has source folder(s) and the 
bad has no source folders (project == root)

Everything using build 0204 with jdk1.4 on windows xp

1. If in the installation that works I use an empty new project with no
> links to any other projects it seems to work provided no other projects are
> included in the build path, if any others are you get the same error as
> before.
> 2. If I add a page to an existing project with other project in the build
> path I get an error.

still the same with build 20020412

The stack trace provided from Nils is a bug but I believe that it is not the 
reason that the snippet evaluation is failing.  "Launch configuration does not 
exist" debug exception is occurring after the snippet VM has already shutdown
(incorrectly).  This is the part we are working to understand.

I figured out the problem: spaces in the Project names!! What tipped me off is 
your suggestion to get the JRE out of the "Program Files" directory. That 
solved the problem for an empty workspace where "test" was the only project, 
but in my normal workspace it seemed to work in some projects, but not others. 
Removing the space solved the problem. Getting rid of spaces everywhere is not 
an option, as we can not change all the project names, and besides all other 
debugging works fine. Also when normally installing the JRE it always 
suggests "Program Files". At this point it should be easy to fix though ;-)
-Leon

This is great...I thought the two problems where unrelated!

We use a URLClassLoader to load the class that we use for the snippet editor 
evaluations.  We are passing it urls that contains spaces. For the rt.jar, I
I thought, but it turns out for the referenced projects as well.
This does not work (obviously!).  I need to properly encode the Strings to 
create the URLs...or anybody else who wants to tackle the problem in 
ScrapbookMain. ;-)

Until that time: to use the scrapbook do not use a JRE/JDK that has spaces in 
the path or reference any projects that have spaces in the name, or use in an 
Eclipse install that has spaces in its path.

i have tested this and it was also the case at my place,
i had one project that didn't have a space in the name and didn't have any 
references to other projects and also the rt.jar of the jdk had no spaces  in 
it. But it of the 25 jars, besides the rt.jar, one jar that was included had a 
space in his path. Removed it and it did work.

A fix has been released into the HEAD stream and will be part of the next 
integration build.
